title: How imperialistic was the USA in the early 20th century? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America
Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: The USA was very imperialistic after the Civil War ended (cf. China trade and missionaries, Japanese trade, Spanish-American war.) Suddenly in 1919 the USA reverted to what was then called "splendid isolation," despite that Charlie Chaplin and Henry Ford had by then reached perhaps every country in the world.

The US DID aspire back then to being joining the leading nations of the world—Spain, Britain, France and Germany in particular, but also Belgium, Holland and Portugal—as a nation with an empire. The purpose of the Spanish-American war was to give us that empire, and it did.: the Philippines, Puerto Rico, Cuba and other holdings.
